questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: He's opening the door.
He's sitting upright in a chair.
He's working with a tool.
He's taking off his running shoes.
questions.script:
（A）He's opening the door.
（B）He's sitting upright in a chair.
（C）He's working with a tool.
（D）He's taking off his running shoes.
（A）他正在开门。
（B）他正笔直地坐在椅子上。
（C）他正在使用一个工具。
（D）他正在脱下他的跑鞋。

他正在使用锤子。
·He's holding a tool.
369

他正拿着一个工具。
·He's concentrating on his work.
他正专心于他的工作。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: He has taken a seat at a workstation.
He is tidying up his work area.
He's turning on the computer.
He's about to sit in the chair.
questions.script:

（B）He is tidying up his work area.
（C）He's turning on the computer.
（D）He's about to sit in the chair.
（A）他已经坐在工作区里了。
（B）他正在清理他的工作区域。
（C）他正在开电脑。
（D）他正要坐到椅子上。
·The man is working at the computer.
男士正在使用电脑。
·He's gathering information from the monitor.
他正在从显示器上收集信息。
·The man is looking at the computer screen.
男士正看着电脑屏幕。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: They're entering the gallery.
They're hanging up some pictures.
They're sketching some art.
They're closely examining a picture.
questions.script:
（A）They're entering the gallery.
（B）They're hanging up some pictures.
（C）They're sketching some art.
（D）They're closely examining a picture.
（A）他们正走进美术馆。
（B）他们正在挂几张画。

（D）他们正在仔细地审视一幅画。

on the wall.
他们正在欣赏墙上的画。
·Some paintings are hanging in a gallery.
几幅画正挂在美术馆里。
·A painting has been hung next to the women.
一幅画已经被挂在了女士的旁边。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The people are loading goods onto a truck.
A man is closing up the storage room.
One of the people is handling heavy machinery.
One man is directing the other man.
questions.script:
（A）The people are loading goods onto a truck.
（B）A man is closing up the storage room.
（C）One of the people is handling heavy machinery.
（D）One man is directing the other man.
（A）人们正在往卡车上装货物。
（B）一位男士正在关闭储物间。
（C）他们中的一个人正在操作沉重的机器。
（D）一位男士正在指挥另一个人。
·A man is operating heavy machinery.
一位男士正在操作沉重的机器。
·Heavy machinery is being used.
沉重的机器正在被使用。
·There is heavy machinery in use at the moment. 现在有一台沉重的机器正
在被使用中。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: A worker is organizing the shelves.
The shelves are lined up against one side of the wall.
There are books neatly arranged on top of the desk.
The map is being taken down at the moment.
questions.script:
（A）A worker is organizing the shelves.
（B）The shelves are lined up against one side of the wall.
（C）There are books neatly arranged on top of the desk.
（D）The map is being taken down at the moment.
（A）一个工人正在整理书架。
（B）书架靠着一面墙排成一排。
（C）书在书桌上整齐地排放着。
（D）地图现在正被取下来。
·The shelves are stocked with reading materials.
书架上放满了读物。
·There are bookshelves against one side of the wall.
一面墙上靠着几个书架。
·Some books have been filled in the shelves.
一些书已经被放到书架上了。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: A man is escorting the woman into the car.
The woman is backing the car out of the driveway.
Several passengers are seated in the backseat of the car.
The door of the vehicle is open.
questions.script:
（A）A man is escorting the woman into the car.
（B）The woman is backing the car out of the driveway.
（C）Several passengers are seated in the backseat of the car.
（D）The door of the vehicle is open.
371

（A）男士正在护送女士上汽车。
（B）女士正把车倒出车道。
（C）几名乘客坐在汽车的后座上。
（D）车门是开着的。
·The woman is about to get in the car.
女士正要上车。
·The passenger door is wide open.
乘客门大开着。
·They are dressed in formal wear.
他们穿着正装。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: Did you have a hard time finding this place?
options: Why don't you take a look at the map?
No, I've been here once before.
This job is easier than you think. 你觉得这个地方难找吗？
questions.script:
Did you have a hard time finding this place?
（A）Why don't you take a look at the map?
（B）No, I've been here once before.
（C）This job is easier than you think.
你觉得这个地方难找吗？
（A）你为什么不看一看地图呢？
（B）不难，我以前来过这里一次。
（C）这个工作比你想的简单一些。
Q Did you have any difficulties in finding this place?
A No, I've been here several times in the past.
你找这个地方有没有遇到困难？
—没有，我过去来过这里几次。

questions.question: What's in the forecast for the weekend?
options: I heard it's going to rain.
Probably on Saturday.
Yes, at the local park. 天气预报说周末的天气怎么样？
questions.script:
What's in the forecast for the weekend?
（A）I heard it's going to rain.
（B）Probably on Saturday.
（C）Yes, at the local park.
天气预报说周末的天气怎么样？
（A）我听说要下雨。

（C）是的，在本地公园。
372

Q What's the weather going to be like this weekend?
A I think rain is in the forecast.
这周末的天气怎么样？
—我记得天气预报说有雨。

questions.question: Did you like the play you just saw?
options: No, I saw her today.
Yes, it was very nice.
Yes, all work and no play. 你喜欢刚才看的戏剧吗？
questions.script:
Did you like the play you just saw?
（A）No, I saw her today.
（B）Yes, it was very nice.
（C）Yes, all work and no play.
你喜欢刚才看的戏剧吗？
（A）不，我今天见到她了。
（B）喜欢，非常好。
（C）是的，只工作，不娱乐。
Q How did you enjoy the play we just saw?
A I really liked it a lot.
你觉得我们刚才看的戏剧怎么样？
—我真的很喜欢。

questions.question: Can I tell John that you came by today?
options: Yes, I will drop by at six.
That won't be necessary.
No, I forgot to call him. 我能告诉约翰你今天来过吗？
questions.script:

我能告诉约翰你今天来过吗？
（A）是的，我会在6点顺道过来。
（B）那没有必要。
（C）不，我忘记给他打电话了。
Q Do you want to let John know that you dropped by today?
A I will tell him myself later.
你想让约翰知道你今天来过吗？
—晚些时候我自己告诉他吧。

questions.question: What is the main reason for your visit?
options: I'm here on business.
This is my third time here.
To the third floor office.
questions.script:

（A）I'm here on business.
（B）This is my third time here.
（C）To the third floor office.
373

你来访的主要原因是什么？
（A）我来这里是因为公事。
（B）这是我第三次来这里。
（C）到三层的办公室去。

A I am here to meet with Mr. Lee.
你今天为什么来？
—我来这儿见李先生。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: How much does all this come to?

No, I won't.
With a credit card. 这些一共多少钱？
questions.script:

（C）With a credit card.
这些一共多少钱？
（A）20美元。
（B）不，我不会。
（C）用信用卡。

A That will be twenty dollars.
总共多少钱？
—总共是20美元。

questions.question: Is Mr. Chen likely going to show up this evening?
options: Most likely not.
Yes, it went up.

options: I acted it.
By this Friday.
Yes, I know. 我什么时候能拿到考试成绩？
questions.script:

（C）是的，我知道。

A This Friday at the latest.
考试成绩什么时候公布？

questions.question: Do you want a lift to the bus terminal?
options: It's a bit too heavy for me.
That would be very nice of you.

A Thanks. I really appreciate it.
你想搭车去公交车站吗？
—谢谢。真的非常感谢。

questions.question: Can I give you a check, or would you prefer cash?
options: It doesn't matter to me.
Yes, I checked it twice.
No, I don't have any money on me. 我可以给你支票吗，还是你更想要现金？
questions.script:
Can I give you a check, or would you prefer cash?
（A）It doesn't matter to me.
（B）Yes, I checked it twice.
（C）No, I don't have any money on me.
我可以给你支票吗，还是你更想要现金？
（A）对我来说没关系。
375

（B）是的，我检查过两遍。
（C）不，我身上没钱。
Q Do you accept personal checks here, or do I have to pay in cash?
A Either way is fine.
你这里接受个人支票吗，还是我必须交现金？
—怎么都行。

questions.question: I wonder who is going to take on the next project, don't you?
options: Sure, I can take it with me today.
Sorry, but I am not going that way.
It will most likely be Jake. 我想知道谁会承担下一个项目，你不想知道吗？
questions.script:
I wonder who is going to take on the next project, don't you?
（A）Sure, I can take it with me today.
（B）Sorry, but I am not going that way.
（C）It will most likely be Jake.
我想知道谁会承担下一个项目，你不想知道吗？
（A）当然，我今天能带着它。
（B）抱歉，我不走那边。
（C）很有可能是杰克。

A I heard Jake is going to get it.
我很好奇下一个项目会分配给谁。
—我听说杰克会承担那个项目。

questions.question: Are there any seats left for tonight's performance?
options: It is going to be very expensive.
Sorry, but it's a full house today.
Sure, here is my ticket. 今晚的演出还有剩余的座位吗？

（A）票会非常贵。

A Sorry, but all the tickets are sold out.
今晚的演出还有剩余的票吗？
—抱歉，所有的票都卖光了。

questions.question: How far is your hotel from here?
options: I'm staying in Room 1204. 376
At the Prince Hotel.
About ten minutes on foot. 你的宾馆离这里多远？
questions.script:

options: He speaks two languages.
Yes, it's much better.
No, it was a bit boring. 你难道不喜欢这个演讲吗？
questions.script:
Didn't you enjoy the speech?
（A）He speaks two languages.
（B）Yes, it's much better.
（C）No, it was a bit boring.
你难道不喜欢这个演讲吗？
（A）他讲两种语言。
（B）是的，好多了。
（C）不喜欢，有点儿枯燥。

A No, it was a little too slow.
你不喜欢这个讲话吗？
—不喜欢，有点儿太慢了。

options: There were just enough.
He works until six today.

（A）There were just enough.
（B）He works until six today.
（C）I already went shopping.
有很多表格发给讨论会上的每个人吗？
（A）正好有足够的表格。
（B）他今天一直工作到6点。
（C）我已经去购物了。

A Yes, I think everyone had a copy.
377

讨论会上有足够的表格分发给每个人吗？
—是的，我想每个人都有一份。

questions.question: Do you feel like shopping today, or would you prefer going another time?
options: I bought a T-shirt.
I feel quite good.
I'm a bit tired today. 你想今天购物还是改天？
questions.script:
Do you feel like shopping today, or would you prefer going another time?
（A）I bought a T-shirt.
（B）I feel quite good.
（C）I'm a bit tired today.
你想今天购物还是改天？
（A）我买了一件T恤。
（B）我感觉很好。
（C）我今天有点儿累。

A I am a bit worn out today.
你今天打算去买东西吗，还是想改天再去？
—我今天有点儿累了。

questions.question: Do you know where to go to get a nice cup of coffee around here?
options: They make a great couple.
Sure, I could use a cup.
Try the café on the second floor. 你知道这儿附近哪里能喝到好喝的咖啡吗？
questions.script:
Do you know where to go to get a nice cup of coffee around here?
（A）They make a great couple.
（B）Sure, I could use a cup.
（C）Try the café on the second floor.
你知道这儿附近哪里能喝到好喝的咖啡吗？
（A）他们是很棒的一对。
（B）当然，我可以用茶杯。
（C）试试看二层的咖啡厅。

here?
A The café on the second floor is good.
你知道我在附近哪儿能买到好喝的咖啡？
—二层的咖啡厅很不错。

questions.question: Do you want to join me for a game of tennis after work?
options: Thanks, but I'll pass this time.
I learned the game a week ago.
There will be three of us going. 你想下班后和我一起打一局网球吗？
questions.script:
Do you want to join me for a game of tennis after work?
（A）Thanks, but I'll pass this time.
（B）I learned the game a week ago.
（C）There will be three of us going.
你想下班后和我一起打一局网球吗？
378

（A）谢谢，这次我就不去了。
（B）我一周前学了这项运动。
（C）我们会有三个人去。
Q Would you care for a game of tennis after we finish work today?
A I'd love to, but I can't today.
今天下班后你想一起打一局网球吗？
—我很想去，可是今天去不了。

questions.question: You have some spare time this morning, don't you?
options: It is ten o'clock now.
Yes, in my office.
I think so. 你今天上午有空，是吗？
questions.script:
You have some spare time this morning, don't you?
（A）It is ten o'clock now.
（B）Yes, in my office.
（C）I think so.
你今天上午有空，是吗？
（A）现在10点了。
（B）是的，在我的办公室。
（C）我想是的。
Q You have a moment to spare this morning, don't you?
A Sure, what's up?
你今天上午能抽出一点儿时间，是吧？
—当然可以，怎么啦？

questions.question: Could you recommend a nice place to take Mr. Lee?
options: I recommended him to the boss.
What type of food does he like?
He will be here for a week. 你能推荐一个可以带李先生去的好地方吗？
questions.script:
Could you recommend a nice place to take Mr. Lee?
（A）I recommended him to the boss.
（B）What type of food does he like?
（C）He will be here for a week.
你能推荐一个可以带李先生去的好地方吗？
（A）我向老板推荐了他。
（B）他喜欢哪种食物？
（C）他会在这里待一周。
Q Would you by chance know of a good restaurant to take Mr. Lee?
A Well, what does he like to eat?
你知道有什么好饭店可以带李先生去吗？
—哦，他喜欢吃什么？

questions.question:
Couldn't we just head over after work?
379
options: He works on the first floor.
No, let's look it over now.
Sure, let's take off at five. 难道我们下班后再过去不好吗？
questions.script:
Couldn't we just head over after work?
379

（A）He works on the first floor.
（B）No, let's look it over now.
（C）Sure, let's take off at five.
难道我们下班后再过去不好吗？
（A）他在一层工作。
（B）不，咱们现在就检查。
（C）当然，咱们5点出发。
Q Don't you think it would be okay to go over after we finish work first?
A Yes, let's leave right at five o'clock.
你不觉得我们先做完工作之后再过去就行吗？
—是的，咱们5点整走。

questions.question: The renovation work they're doing is very loud.
options: It will be completed next year.
Why don't you shut the windows?
There will be plenty of work. 他们正在做的修缮工作很吵。
questions.script:
The renovation work they're doing is very loud.
（A）It will be completed next year.
（B）Why don't you shut the windows?
（C）There will be plenty of work.
他们正在做的修缮工作很吵。
（A）明年能结束。
（B）你为什么不关上窗户呢？
（C）会有很多工作。
Q The construction work is making a lot of noise.
A You should close the windows.
建筑工作产生了很多噪音。
—你应当关上窗户。

questions.question: Don't you have to prepare the tables for the meeting tonight?
options: A table for four, please.
We are meeting today.
No, Jack will do it later. 你难道不需要为今晚的会议准备桌子吗？
questions.script:
Don't you have to prepare the tables for the meeting tonight?
（A）A table for four, please.
（B）We are meeting today.
（C）No, Jack will do it later.
你难道不需要为今晚的会议准备桌子吗？
（A）请准备一张四人桌。
（B）我们今天见面。
（C）不，过一会儿杰克会准备。
Q Don't you have to set up the tables for this evening's meeting?
380

A I asked Jack to take care of it.
你难道不用为今晚的会议安排桌子吗？
—我让杰克负责这件事了。

questions.question: Why don't you take a break and stay home for a few days?
options: Thanks, I had a great vacation.
I wish I could, but I have too much work.
The one here is much stronger. 你为什么不休息一下，在家待几天呢？
questions.script:
Why don't you take a break and stay home for a few days?
（A）Thanks, I had a great vacation.
（B）I wish I could, but I have too much work.
（C）The one here is much stronger.
你为什么不休息一下，在家待几天呢？
（A）谢谢，我的假期很愉快。
（B）我也希望这样，但是我的工作太多了。
（C）这里的这个强壮多了。
Q Why don't you take it easy and take a few days off?
A I wish I could, but I have to finish this project first.
你为什么不放松点儿，休几天假？
—我也希望这样，但是我得先完成这个项目。

questions.question: You don't have to make copies today, do you?
options: I already had two cups, thanks.
No, I could do it tomorrow morning.
I should be able to make it there. 你今天不必复印，是吧？
questions.script:
You don't have to make copies today, do you?
（A）I already had two cups, thanks.
（B）No, I could do it tomorrow morning.
（C）I should be able to make it there.
你今天不必复印，是吧？
（A）我已经喝了两杯了，谢谢。
（B）是的，我可以明天上午做。
（C）我应该能准时到那儿。
Q You can make the copies tomorrow, can't you?
A Yes, I have time until noon tomorrow.
你可以明天复印，是吧？

的情况，我也能下车，跑着过去。

This brings us to the final stage of our tour and a most welcome one: it's
the company café.（74）We hope that you will be pleasantly surprised by the

Questions 80 through 82 refer to the following telephone message.
Hello, Mr. Duvall. This is Tony from the Reservations Department at the
National Opera. I received your message, and I want to answer your queries
regarding the performance tomorrow.（80）As you know, Thursday is a popular
night, so I suggest that you book immediately and pay for your tickets before 5
p.m. this evening.（81）As for a group booking, at present, there are fifteen seats
available to your group, but unfortunately they are not all together. I am hoping that
this will be okay. Anyway, if you do decide to take these tickets, I can offer you
a generous group discount of 20 percent. All you need to do is call me to
confirm（82）and then come in to the reservations office to pick up your tickets. I
hope you have a nice evening.

想解答一下您关于明晚演出的疑问。您也知道，周四晚上很火，所以我建议
您马上预订，并且在今晚5点之前支付票款。关于团体预订，目前有15个座
位可以提供给您的团体，不过很不巧它们不都在一块儿。我希望这没有大
碍。总之，如果您决定买这些票，我可以给您八折的团队优惠折扣。您需要
做的就是打电话给我确认并来预订办公室取票。希望您度过一个愉快的夜
晚。

Questions 83 through 85 refer to the following speech.
Good evening, everybody. I'd just like to say a few words before officially
opening the exhibition.（83）I'm very pleased to see so many faces here tonight.
It seems that many people share my interest in the history of the Old Town. And it is
a fascinating history! These documents, photographs, artworks, and other
historical items vividly reflect the life of the Old Town,（84）from its Roman
beginnings until modern times. My special thanks to the local library and
museum for all their work and also to our many private contributors.（85）
大家晚上好。我想在展览正式开幕之前讲几句话。很高兴今晚在这里见
到了这么多来宾。看起来很多人都和我一样对老城的历史有着浓厚的兴趣，
而且它的历史又是这样引人入胜！这些文件、照片、工艺品和其他历史文物
生动地展现了老城从罗马开创时期到现代的生活面貌。我要特别感谢地方图
书馆和博物馆所做的工作，并感谢众多的个人捐赠者。

Questions 89 through 91 refer to the following speech.
Well, as you can see, I am surprised and overwhelmed by this award.
（89）I'd especially like to dedicate the “Young Entrepreneur of the Year” trophy
to my mother, who has always supported me. Actually, it was in my mother's
garage that I developed my hobby into a successful business. I started as a
child, building the electronic project kits that she bought me.（90）I soon
began making modifications, and from there I moved on to design. Now I provide
secure computer networks for large corporations all over North America. Well, I'm
one of those lucky people who have become rich doing what they love!
（91）Thanks again to everybody who has made it possible.（89）
哦，大家都看到了，我得到这个奖特别惊喜，都有些不知所措了。我特
别想把这个“年度青年企业家”奖杯献给一直以来都在支持我的母亲，实际
上，我就是在母亲的车库里把兴趣发展成了成功的事业。我从小便开始装配
她给我买的电气工程套件。后来我开始进行改进，然后又开始设计。现在我
给遍布北美的大型公司提供安全的电脑网络服务。是的，我是一个幸运的
人，靠做自己喜欢的事致富！再次感谢所有让这一切成为可能的人。

secure 安全的，可靠的 all over 遍及，到处 achieve 达到 launch 发布 gadget

Questions 92 through 94 refer to the following talk.
Welcome, everybody, to the “City at Night” tour. My name's Barbara,
and I'll be your guide（92）and host this evening. I know that many of you know
Blackburn well, but I hope that you are going to enjoy seeing a different side of this
city. First, we'll be visiting Blackburn's medieval fortress. And I should warn you
that we will be visiting the dungeons and torture chamber. Then we'll go to
historic Wetherby Mansion. There are rumors that it is haunted by the ghost of
Lady Wetherby,（93）who disappeared mysteriously five hundred years ago.
And finally, to finish on a happier note, there will be a champagne supper in
Blackburn Tower Park, which has a splendid view of the sparkling city lights
and the surrounding hills.（94）
欢迎大家参加“城市之夜”的旅行。我叫芭芭拉，是今晚的导游和接待
员。我知道你们中有很多人已经非常了解布莱克本，不过，我希望大家可以
愉快地领略这个城市的另一面。首先，我们将会参观布莱克本的中世纪城
堡。我要提醒大家的是我们还会参观地牢和刑讯室。然后我们会去历史上著
名的韦瑟比庄园。有传闻说那里有韦瑟比夫人的鬼魂出没，五百年前她在那
儿神秘地消失了。最后，我们可以高兴一点儿，在布莱克本的塔楼公园里将
举行一场香槟晚宴，在那里我们可以观赏城市璀璨的灯火和环绕的群山。

等）出没于 mysteriously 神秘地 supper 晚餐 splendid 美妙的

the usual food, and we'll also play a wide variety of games and do other activities.

Hello, Jason. This is Steve Meyers. I'd like to inform you that I'm getting close
to where you are right now. I just passed a sign indicating that I need to get off
422

the interstate in six kilometers.（98）I know the restaurant we're meeting at
is close to the exit, so I estimate that I'll be there in about ten minutes.（99）

know what I like. I hope you brought your laptop with you.（100）I need to
show you some files, but mine is in the shop, so I wasn't able to bring it.
你好，杰森。我是史蒂夫·迈耶斯。我想告知你，我正在接近你目前所
在的位置。我刚通过一个指示牌，表明我需要在六公里后驶离州际公路。我
了解到我们约见的餐厅离公路出口很近，所以我估计十分钟之内就能到达那
里。如果你想提前去并点上饮料和开胃菜，那么请别客气。你知道我喜欢什

里了，所以我没法带。
